thread.title_full: Ben Cherington out, Dave Dombrowski in as Red Sox boss | Clubhouse Insider | Boston Red Sox News | Boston Herald

author: Herald Staff
title: Ben Cherington out, Dave Dombrowski in as Red Sox boss | Clubhouse Insider | Boston Red Sox News
text:
The Red Sox have made a major change.
The team announced Tuesday night that Ben Cherington is stepping down as general manager and Dave Dombrowski will be coming aboard as the new president of baseball operations.
Dombrowski, who has led the Expos, Marlins and Tigers in his career, was let go by Detroit within the past month. He was the general manager of the Marlins when Red Sox principal owner John Henry owned that team before buying the Sox.
He takes over a team that seemd headed for its third last-place finish in four seasons.
Cherington declined the opportunity to continue to serve as general manager under Dombrowski, the Red Sox said. He is less than two years removed from leading the Sox to the 2013 World Series title, but has seen his team underachieve since then.
More to come
